For once, i'll do a constructive review :

Counter-Strike : Global Offensive is good. Although it was a disaster at launch, its popularity skyrocketed since then. The game used to be on Valve's waiting list, but now big daddy Gaben is more present than ever before with regular bug patches and major updates around twice per year. CSGO has a bright future, with enough trial and error the CSGO team could easily outplay big shooter titles like Battlefield, COD or maybe even R6.

CSGO is like that one kid in class who used not to work at all, got bad grades and didn't care. But one day he decided to stop being a b*tch and start working. This kid would give everything he has, even throwing away time with his family, to in the end, still get basic grades.

The moral of the story is that, although in 2012 everyone looked at CSGO for being bad and not worked on well enough, today it might just overthrow all these past bullies it had on its back.

CSGO is on the grind, and it's gonna make it.
